org.openlcb.implementations

Class BlueGoldExtendedEngine

Show UML class diagram
  • java.lang.Object
    • org.openlcb.AbstractConnection
      • org.openlcb.MessageDecoder
        • org.openlcb.implementations.BlueGoldEngine
          • org.openlcb.implementations.BlueGoldExtendedEngine
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Connection

    public class BlueGoldExtendedEngine
extends BlueGoldEngine
    Example of a OpenLCB algorithm for doing configuration with small number of buttons. This an extended form that allows multiple selection and deselection.

    • On learners, push blue to choose a C/P, then gold to put that C/P in learn mode (complete cycle turns off blue light and starts over)
    • On the teaching node, push gold to choose teach mode, then blue to select a C/P, push Gold to send the TeachEvent message

    This handles both "configuring" and "being configured" cases. It also handles both consumers and producers via working with the SingleConsumerNode and SingleProducerNode example classes.

    For button inputs, it currently has only "click" operations. Perhaps "down" and "up" will be needed eventually. Similarly, it only does "on" and "off" for the two lights.
